loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa lives in a simple house at Baculud along with her husband and child. She and her husband cultivate rice on a hectare plot of land that they sell to traders in their village. Ma Luisa usually earns about 15,000 PHP during each harvest season, twice in a year. Her income provides for their meals, allowances, and provides revolving capital. 

Ma. Luisa would like to ensure a good crop and is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide to improve her yield in the coming harvest seasons. In the future, she hopes to keep making her crops productive and achieve a prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Srey Pov is 41 years old. She is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Srey Pov is a homemaker and her husband is a construction worker who also runs a motor taxi service and earns approximately 13 USD daily. Her children are employed and earn about 5 USD each day. 

Srey Pov is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to pay for her child’s wedding ceremony. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a widow who lives in Don Domingo with her one child. She carries the burden alone to provide for her child's school fees. Angelina works selling clothing and accessories from her stall at the public market and earns about 10,000 PHP each month.

Angelina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more clothing, caps, and belts to sell. In the future, she wants to earns a consistent profit from her business to achieve a stable business that will ensure a good future for her child.

loans.use: to buy clothing, caps, and belts to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer operates a livestock business. She currently raised one bore, six piglets and one fattening pig. Her main priority in life is to increase her profit to support the education of her three children. One of them is college, the other one is high school while the youngest is in elementary level.

She works hard in order to earn a living but the income generated from the hog raising business is not enough to cover all the  expenses. She is asking for financial support in the amount of P12,000 to be able to buy hog feed and vaccines to improve the health of her raised hogs. She believes that her patience and sacrifice will give her fruitful outcome and enable her to improve their living condition and save some for the bright future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and vaccines for her raised hogs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old, and is married and blessed with one child. Joseph is a farmer working in the Philippines. He has been managing his farm for 15 years. Joseph is a responsible father and husband to his wife. He is willing to work hard every day just to lift his family from poor living.

Right now Joseph is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to sustain his farm business. He hopes to grow his farm and received a higher income and to secure his family living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to sustain his farm business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and is married to Eduardo, a responsible father who helps her to manage their family's farmland. For the past 18 years, she has devoted herself full-time to her business as a rice farmer. Helen has a great desire to improve her family's living situation and she works hard to give her children a good quality of life and lift her family out of poverty. 

Helen is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. In the future, she hopes to increase her yield with the help of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 58 years old. She lives in the village of Alinam and owns and operates a farming business. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Leticia has been in this business for over 12 years and she earns approximately 28,000 PHP with each crop. 

Leticia is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase seeds, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a farmer in the village of Alinam. He is 50 years old and is married to Mercedes, a responsible mother, who helps him to manage their family farm land. Antonio has been in this business for 12 years and he usually earn an income amount of PHP 30,000 every cropped season.

At this time, Antonio is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 48,000 to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and to pay the labor cost for planting rice. He hopes to further grow his farm business, to lift up his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and to pay the labor cost for planting rice.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram lives in Yeghegnadzor town with his mother. He works at the local military unit and also is involved in a beekeeping business with his mother. Aram's father has gone abroad to work and sustain the family. Aram is an enthusiastic and eager person. 

Aram is requesting a loan to purchase seven beehives. Developing the family's beekeeping business will increase his family's income. In the future, Aram dreams of establishing a bigger farm and he hopes his loan will be a good start for making his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase seven beehives

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 44 years old and is a widow who lives with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For the past ten years, she has been selling food and dessert and she earns approximately 5 USD per day. One of Sokha's children is employed as a receptionist who earns about 3 USD per day. 

Sokha is requesting a 600 USD loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting. Her family has difficulties with transportation and this purchase will enable her to save expenses to support her family. In the future, Sokha would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 53 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For the past ten years, she has been selling vegetables, earning approximately 12 USD per day. Her husband helps her run the business and two of her children are employed as a construction worker and a chef. Heng's children each earn about 5 USD per day. 

Heng is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to build a new house. She will use her loan to purchase construction materials. Her loan will help provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, Heng would like to expand her business and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur lives in Yeghegnadzor town with his family: his parents and sister. He works at the local military unit as a driver. Besides that, he is involved in agriculture on the family farm, which was founded nine years ago. Bakur raises calves and breeds fish in a little lake near the house. Bakur would like to keep more animals on the farm, for which he has applied for this loan. He wants to purchase one more calf and more fish.

Bakur dreams of establishing a big farm, which will provide a stable income for his family. This young farmer plans to start his family and create prosperous living conditions for them. With development of agriculture, Bakur will have better opportunities to implement his plans for his life.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and more fish

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 50 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation situation, Saly is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest son earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Pictured above is Kadiatu, a bar owner in the northern city of Makeni. Age thirty-eight, Kadiatu is married and has two children attending secondary schools. Kadiatu has been selling both hard and soft drinks for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to further expand her business. She will use her loan to buy soft drinks, malt drinks, energy drinks, alcoholic drinks, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, malt drinks, energy drinks, alcoholic drinks, etc. to add to her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando operates a farm for a living. According to him, he only finished elementary school. Fernando is now 53 years old and is married to Cleofe. This couple is blessed with two children who go to school.

Fernando and his wife both perform farming activities to economize on hiring laborers. Now, he would like to increase his income to be able to support his children's education.

Fernando has successfully repaid his previous loans from ASKI. So, he is requesting a new loan of PHP 18,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies and to pay for hired laborers in transplanting his one hectare of rice field. He is hoping for continuous access to financial services coming from Kiva lenders and ASKI so that he can improve his family's financial stability and obtain better crop production.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for hired laborers in transplanting his farm plot.

loans.name: Tristan

texts.en:
Tristan is the second child in the family. He did not finish his studies due to lack of financial resources. He belongs to a family whose main source of income is a farming business. Though he didn't finish his studies, he is still grateful because he is able to run his family's farm.

Tristan's priority is to earn a bigger income to sustain his family's basic needs, improve their house, and send his niece and nephew to school. To make his dream happen, he would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 50,000, allowing him to buy farm inputs that will be used to increase his rice crop production. He believes that, in this way, he can earn greater profits which will serve his family's needs and provide capital for the next crop season.

loans.use: to be use in buying farm inputs for his agricultural business

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Pictured here is Rugiatu, a small scale businesswoman based in Makeni. Madam Rugiatu sells slippers and has been running this business for many years now. A native of Makeni, the forty-year-old woman is married and has four children. Rugiatu’s husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary school. With this loan, Rugiatu is going to expand her business. She will use her loan to buy dozens of slippers to add to her current stock. This will lead to an increase in sales and profit, and eventually, her standard of living will also improve.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to her current stock

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is 46 years old and is married to Lolita. He is a farmer, working in the village of Alinam. He has been in this business for 15 years and earns about PHP 25,000 every harvest season. Abraham wants to plant and harvest rice to sell. In this regard, Abraham is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers to sustain his farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested for the further growth of his business and to continue providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizers to sustain his farm

loans.name: Neour

texts.en:
Neour is 51 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband is a fisherman who earns about $5 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Neour is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a boat with an engine for her husband to use for fishing. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a boat with an engine for her husband to use for fishing.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine is 37 years old. She lives in Zedea with her husband and two daughters. Kristina works at a local milk factory. Kristine's husband is a military officer. However, the main source of income for the family is agriculture. Kristine and her husband breed livestock and keep beehives and hens.  Kristine wants to expand her farm, but she has a lack of necessary funds. This loan will help her to purchase a calf and five beehives. It is important for Kristine to receive and sell more agricultural products and get more income, which will help her cover the family's costs and ensure financial stability for them.

loans.use: To pay for a calf and five beehives

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is grateful because for six years of raising rice crops he has been able to supply his family's basic necessities.  The main source of income for his family is planting and harvesting of rice crops for sale.

Rodel's wife is an insurance agent. The couple would like to start a general store so they can earn extra income to save for the education of their two children. To obtain his goal, he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 30,000, which will be used to buy necessary fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides. He believes that this loan will help his yield increase, as well as his profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino aims to expand the farm land area he cultivates in order to earn a larger income to sustain his family's needs. He works hard on his farm so that he can make it more productive. In this way, he can support his children's education and improve their financial stability.

Avelino and his wife both perform farming activities to economize on hiring people to till their farm plot and plant rice crops to sell. He plans to buy farm inputs to ensure proper nutrition of his rice crops, but he does not have enough funds from his farm land business. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000. Avelino would be glad if his requested loan amount is granted.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his farming business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 47 years old. She is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For the past two years, she has been selling food and groceries and she earns approximately 5 USD per day. Her husband is an electrician who earn about 3 USD per day. One of her children is a construction worker who earns about 3 USD daily.

Ny is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase construction materials to rebuild her present house. Her loan will help provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Némé

texts.fr: Némé est une dame de 43ans. Elle est veuve et a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 13ans et le dernier 08ans.  Elle a commencé par vendre les charbons de bois à domicile et de façon ambulante (la livraison à ses clients) depuis 1997. Sa difficulté est le fait de ne pas avoir du charbon de bois en saison pluvieuse. Elle est à son cinquième crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut agrandir le commerce et avoir un stock important pour mieux servir ses clients. Madame Némé veut assurer l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Némé is a 43 year old woman. She is a widow who has 2 children, aged 8 and 13, who both go to school. 

Since 1997, she's been selling wood coal out of her home and on foot (she does delivery for her clients). 

Her problem is that she doesn't have wood coal during the rainy season. This is her fifth loan, and she wants to use this loan to buy bags of wood coal. 

She would like to grow her business and have a large inventory to better serve her clients.

Madame Némé would like to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of wood coal.

loans.name: Kilongawima Group

texts.en:
Deborah, who is in her mid-40s, is married with five children and has one grandchild.  All of them are still in school. She has been running a genge-duka business, which means that she sells fruits, vegetables, sugar, wheat flour, baking flour, salt, beans, and bananas all in the same shop. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijene Tanzania, which she wants to use for increasing the stock of her genge-duka business. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Kilongawima, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock for her store

loans.name: Noufoh

texts.fr: Noufoh est mère de 02 enfants. Ils vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 22ans et le dernier 19ans.  En 2006, elle fait la restauration à domicile et est aidée par 02 personnes. Sa difficulté est la mévente. Elle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaires pour la restauration et des céréales. Elle agrandir l’activité, diversifier le menu et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Noufoh is the mother of two children. They both go to school. The first child is 22 years old, and the last is 19. Since 2006, Noufoh has been in the restaurant business in her home. She is assisted by two persons. Her problem is a drop in sales. She has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy some supplies for food service and some grains. She wants to expand her business, diversify the menu, and  ensure her family's vital needs are met.

loans.use: to buy grains and grocery items

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.
Enyonam travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vend des céréales et des tubercules d’igname pour tous clients en se promenant dans la ville. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Enyonam a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des tubercules d’igname. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Enyonam voudrait ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de meilleures conditions de vie pour sa vie.
texts.en:
Enyonam is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a mechanic and has two children, one of whom attends school. The first is five years old and the last is three.

Enyonam has been working as a reseller since 1999. She sells grain cereals and yam tubers to all comers by walking through the city.

She buys her products in Lome and works alone. At this time her main difficulty is being unable to meet all demands.

Enyonam has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy grain cereals and yam tubers. She wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Enyonam would like to open a general food store. She said that the profits will provide her with better living conditions.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals and yam tubers

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos grows rice crops in the village where he lives. The income generated from his farming business has helped his family in terms of buying their food and milk for his two children and other basic necessities.

Santos started his farming business at the age of 16. He is thankful, because his wife is helping him generate income through her homed-based store. Santos hopes to have a stable income so that he can provide for all of their needs, most especially for his two kids.

Santos would like to apply for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to buy farm supplies for his agricultural business. He knows that his farming business will continue to grow, because of the financial support given to him by ASKI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his agricultural business

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Yawo est un homme âgé de 48 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 4 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 1 ans.
Yawo travaille comme jardinier revendeur depuis 2001. Il vend des engrais pour tous clients dans son jardin. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille avec 1 employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Yawo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des engrais, des graines à semer. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawo voudrait agrandir son commerce et la taille de son jardin. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawo is a 48-year-old man, married to a retailer. He has four children, three of whom attend school. The eldest is eleven years old and the youngest is one.

Yawo has been working as a retail gardener since 2001. He sells fertilizer to all comers in his garden. He buys his products in Lome and has one employee. At this time, his main problem is being out of stock.

Yawo requested his first loan from WAGES to buy fertilizer and seeds for sowing. He wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Yawo would like to expand his business and the size of his garden. He said that with the profits he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: Buy garden produce, fertilizers, ...

loans.name: Wadou

texts.fr:
Wadou est une femme âgé(e) de 42ans. Elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le premier a 17ans et le dernier 13ans.
Wadou travaille comme revendeuse de sous-vêtements et des habits  depuis 1997. Elle vend dans un marché de la place et sa difficulté est la mévente. 
Wadou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sous-vêtements et des habits. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Wadou is a 41-year-old woman. She is the mother of two children. The first is 17 years old, and the last is 13. Wadou has been working as a retailer of undergarments and clothing since 1997. She sells at a local market, and her main difficulty is a drop in sales. 

Wadou has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy undergarments and some clothing. She wants to reinvest in her business and to ensure that her family thrives.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and clothing

loans.name: Dorothee

texts.fr: Dorothee est une mère de 02enfants. Le premier a 26ans et le dernier 23ans. Son conjoint est revendeur et elle est âgée de 49ans. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois à domicile et est à son second crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de renforcer son activité par l’achat de charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Dorothee is a mother of two children. The first is 26 years old, and the last is 23. Dorothee is 49 years old, and her husband is a retailer. She is a charcoal seller at her home and is on her second WAGES loan. This loan she is requesting will enable her to bolster her business by buying charcoal. Dorothee wants to reinvest in her business and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.fr:
Kouassi est un homme âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié å une ménagère. Il a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Kouassi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des cartes de recharges pour tous clients à domicile. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kouassi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kouassi voudrait construire ou louer une boutique pour y exercer son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouassi is a 39-year-old man, married to a housewife. He has two children, one of whom attends school. The first is five years old and the last is two.

Kouassi has been working as a retailer since 2010. He sells recharge cards to allcomers at home. He resupplies in Lome and works alone. At this time his main problem is being out of stock.

Kouassi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy recharge cards. He wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Kouassi would like to build or rent a shop to carry on his business. He said that with the profits he intends to take care of his family.

loans.use: Buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend du charbon de bois, du maïs et des tubercules d’igname pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille avec 1 employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Afiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois, du maïs et des tubercules d’igname. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has three children, two of whom attend school. The eldest is eight years old and the youngest is two.

Afiwa has been working as a reseller since 2009. She sells charcoal, corn and yam tubers to all comers at home. She buys her products in Lome and has one employee. At this time, her main problem is being out of stock.

Afiwa requested her first loan from WAGES to buy charcoal, corn and yam tubers. She wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years Afiwa would like to expand her business. She said that with the profits she plans to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kyewanula Group

texts.en:
Kyewanula group is located on the outskirts of Lyantonde town. The group is comprised mainly of women whose major activity is agriculture. They fall into different categories including divorcees, widows, single mothers and a few who are married.

Sulaina is a single mother of four children. She is divorced from her husband who had another wife. Her four children are all in school. In addition, she looks after her nephew who is an orphan.

Sulaina is mainly an agriculturalist who grows crops and raises goats and chicken. She supplements the farming with income from a small retail shop with capital of UGX 50,000. She resorted to farming in 2000 after separating from her husband so that she could fend for her children and take them to school. She does all this single handedly.

She will use the loan to buy goats to sell, to buy more stock for the retail business and use some of the money to pay school fees. Her main customers are neighbors and passersby. The main challenge is theft around the village. Sometimes thieves steal her goats after she has invested her money in them, especially the loan money, and this affects her cash flow. Sometimes she or her children fall sick and on those days she is unable to work on her land. Despite all the challenges, Sulaina is very hard working and determined to change her future and that of her children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: To buy goats for sell, to buy more stock for the retail business and to pay school fees

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Komlan est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 1 enfant âgé de 4 ans qui va à l’école.
Komlan travaille comme cuisinier revendeur. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille avec 1 employé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Komlan a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Komlan voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et ouvrir une autre boutique. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komlan is a 31-year-old man, married to a hairdresser. He has a four-year-old child who attends school. 

Komlan works as a cook and a retail merchant. He sells general food products to all comers in his shop. He buys his products in Lome and has one employee. At this time, his main problem is being out of stock.

Komlan requested his first loan from WAGES to buy general food products. He wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Komlan would like to expand his business and open another shop. He said that with the profits, he plans to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Amah est une femme âgé(e) de 52 ans. Elle est mariée å un  retraité. Elle a 06 enfants. L’ainé a 33ans et le dernier 20ans.
Amah travaille comme revendeuse de produits vivriers depuis 1993. Elle est aidée par 01 personne et exerce l’activité à domicile. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé.
Amah a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits vivriers. Elle veut agrandir l’activité et diversifier la marchandise. Elle veut assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Amah is 52 years old. Her husband is retired. She has 6 children between the ages of 33 and 20.
Since 1993, Amah has worked as a retailer of food products. She has one assistant, and she works from home. She obtains her supplies in Lomé.
Amah has obtained her first loan from WAGES in order to buy food products. She wants to expand her business and diversify her merchandise. Amah wants to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Tayepsu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Tayepsu group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. The 32 year old is married to a trader, and they have three children who are attending secondary school. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells gara cloths (locally dyed cloths). With her share of this loan, she will buy gara-making materials: ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of gara cloths to sell.

loans.use: To buy gara-making materials: ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of gara cloths to sell

loans.name: Apéléte

texts.fr:
Apelete est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Apelete travaille comme revendeur depuis 2009. Il vend des Cd et des DVD pour tous clients au grand marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Apelete a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des CD et des DVD. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Apelete voudrait devenir grossiste. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de fonder un foyer.
texts.en:
Apelete is a 27-year-old man. He is single and has no children. 

Apelete has been working as a retailer since 2009. He sells CDs and DVDs to all comers at the grand market. He buys his products in Lome and works alone. At this time, his main problem is being out of stock.

Apelete requested his second loan from WAGES to buy CDs and DVDs. He wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Apelete would like to become a wholesaler. He said that with the profits, he plans to start a family.

loans.use: Buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is 56 years old. He is a widower and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has been growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. One of his children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. Pheap wants to rebuild his present house. With this goal in mind, Pheap is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his child earn their bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild his house

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is married with four children. His eldest son is already working, his second child is a driver of jeepney transportation, the third is still studying, and the youngest is in pre-school. Robert hopes to support his two younger children in their studies.

Robert is engaged in the livestock business. He plans to purchase hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines to improve the growth of his raised hogs, so that, when they reach their optimum growth, he can sell them for a higher price. He believes that he can earn more income which would allow him to support his two children through a higher level of education. With regards to his dream in life, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. He hopes that his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy piles of firewood to add to her current stock

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Darhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his children are college, school, and kindergarten students. Batsaihan operates a milk and egg sales business. He started his business in 1991. Now he owns over 250 chickens, 7 ducks, 2 turkeys, 20 horses and cows, and 200 sheep and goats. He sells different types of milk such as cow, sheep, and goat milk. Since his number of cows is growing every year, he needs bigger place. He feeds his animals with organic natural food. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I am losing a lot of my opportunities due to the poor farm condition and lack of equipment. If I can build a new place, I believe it will boost my production up to 50%." He is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to build a bigger place for his cows so he can sell milk.

loans.use: to build a bigger place for his cows so he can sell milk.

loans.name: Raimatou

texts.fr: Raimatou, âgée de 44 ans, est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle a une mercerie et vend ses articles aux détaillants et aux couturiers. Raimatou commercialise également des produits de beauté et fait ses empruntes à l'extérieur du Bénin depuis 27 ans. Elle veut s'acheter des cartons de file et de lait corporel ainsi que des balles de popeline. Raimatou avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de son enfant. Avec le concours obtenu, elle désire renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: Raimatou, 44 years old, is married and a mother of a child who attends school. She has a dry goods store and sells goods to retailers and dressmakers. Raimatou also sells beauty products and has been taking loans from outside of Benin for 27 years. She wants to buy boxes of thread and body lotion, as well as some poplin. Raimatou wants to use her profits to help pay for her child’s education. With this aid, she wants to build up her business funds.

loans.use: 10 boxes of thread, 4 balls of poplin, and 4 boxes of body lotion

loans.name: Luz Patricia

texts.en:
Luz Patricia owns a carinderia (eatery) within the local community where she lives. She is married and blessed with six children. Three of her children currently go to school.

She and her husband have been working together to sustain their family's needs. With her hopes and faith in God, she believes that she will be a better entrepreneur someday because God can make things possible. 

Luz Patricia would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000, which she will use to buy raw meat, fish, seasonings, vegetables, and other kitchen supplies to improve her carinderia. She knows that satisfying her customers' demand will increase her sales. She is findings ways to develop her small carinderia, so that she can make it into a larger one that is much more comfortable for all of her customers. In addition, she could attract more customers and provide quality service for all.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, fish, seasonings, vegetables, and other kitchen supplies to improve her carinderia (eatery)

loans.name: Lavi Miyo De Savann Okan 1 & 2 Group

texts.fr:
Marie est la coordinatrice de son groupe lavi miyo de Savanne Okan 1 & 2. Elle n'est pas marié et elle a 7 enfants. Marie habite dans la région de savanne aux camps nord `est d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Marie a dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant les dernières 7 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Marie était une venduse de poisson. 

Marie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans des vente des produits divers. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de Lavi miyo ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques. Marie dit que son rêve est obtenir une epicerie.
texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group Lavi Miyo of Savanne Okan 1 & 2. She is not married and has 7 children. Marie lives in the savanna region in the northeast camps of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Marie has been selling miscellaneous items for the last 7 years. Before starting this business, Marie sold fish.

Marie would like to use this loan to invest in selling miscellaneous products. She hopes this loan will help her to obtain bigger business. Other members of Lavi Miyo need a loan for businesses selling food and cosmetic goods. Marie says that her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products, like shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a strong and optimistic woman. She is 44 years of age and happily married to Ariel. In her husband's absence, she fulfills the roles of both father and mother for her four children. It was really hard for her in the beginning but as the days pass by, she is able to abide these things through the guidance of our God Almighty. According to Janette, although she receives remittances from her husband, their income is not enough to pay for the tuition of her college student and their daily household expenses.

Janette decided to start a business, in order to help her husband in generating income to cover all of their expenses. With the aid of her remittances, she has been able to establish her own business, raising hogs and vending homemade snacks, such as donuts, pancit cabagan (a noodle dish), and kropek (a prawn-flavored cracker).

Once again, Janette is struggling with a shortage of income due to the expensive prices of hog feed and vaccines. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000. She hopes that she can provide her hogs with proper nutrition so that they will reach their optimum growth and she will obtain greater profits. She will use her additional income to finance her children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Kuistabelle

texts.en:
Kuistabelle runs her general store since 2005. She is thankful because she has been able to maintain her business up to this time. 

Kuistabelle is 28 years old and married with two children. Her spouse is a gasoline boy. Her only goal is to increase her sales and educate her two children. According to her, she uses four cavans (sacks) of hog feed weekly. Kuistabelle is also involved in the hog-raising business as her additional source of income. She hopes for further growth of her general store.

Kuistabelle would like to take out a loan of PHP 13,000 which would allow her to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and profit. She knows that this loan amount would really make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of flour, sugar, etc. in order to bake a larger quantity of bread to sell

loans.name: Bunthea

texts.en: Bunthea is 27 years old. She is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been  growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Bunthea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase farmland for rice cultivation. This money will help her expand her business and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Chérifatou est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, Chérifatou a un niveau d'instruction primaire et commercialise des bois de chauffage à domicile depuis 25 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Sa clientèle est constituée des détaillants et surtout des femmes. Chérifatou prévoit aider son mari face aux besoins de leurs enfants. Ainsi dans le besoin de financement pour agrandir son commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev.
texts.en: At 46 years old, Chérifatou is married and the mother of two, both of whom attend school. Chérifatou has an elementary school education and has been selling firewood from her home for 25 years. She stocks up in neighboring villages. Her clientele consists of retailers and especially women. Chérifatou foresees helping her husband with the needs of their children. With the financial need to grow her business, she sought and received a micro loan from Finadev.

loans.use: to buy 5 batches of firewood

loans.name: Totambola Malamu Plus Group

texts.en:
“Totambola Malamu Plus” is a group of 31 owners of small businesses chaired by Falga. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Falga sells miscellaneous goods such as soft drinks, corn and cassava flour, palm oil, soaps, etc. He has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2011. He is a hard-working man who has demonstrated some abilities in business such as organization and good management. Falga is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of his goods in order to meet the high demand of his customers in his community. He is confident about his business. He knows how to attract his customers by offering what they need and like. He is also diplomatic when he talks with his clients. Falga’s business brings in about US $45 of profit per week. He is 21 years old and single. His dream is to become a wholesaler in his community.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for resale.

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr:
Koku est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 3 semaines.
Koku travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des œufs pour tous clients à domicile. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il exerce l'activité seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Koku a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des œufs. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Koku voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Koku is a 37-year old man, who is married to a retailer. He has three children, two of whom are at school. The eldest is eight years old and the youngest three weeks old. Koku has been working as a retailer since 2010 and sells eggs for all sorts of customers at home. He buys his products in Lomé and works alone. His main problem at the moment is that he is out of stock. He has requested his fourth loan from WAGES so that he can buy eggs. He wants to reinvest in his business. In the next few years, Koku would like to expand his business. He says that he is planning to provide for his family with the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Nelik

texts.en: Nelik lives in Hartashen village with her husband and two children. The family earns their main income from cattle breeding: they raise livestock and pigs and sell the milk and meat. Nelik needs some financial investment to develop pig breeding. With the help of this loan she will purchase pigs. This means increased income for Nelik and her family. Nelik wants to provide opportunities for higher education for her children and a more developed agriculture business allows her to provide such opportunity for them.

loans.use: to pay for pigs.

loans.name: Borrow And Pay Group

texts.en:
Abubakarr is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Abubakarr was born in northern Sierra Leone. He is 50 years old. He is married to a trader and the couple has two children attending secondary school. Abubakarr is a photographer and has been doing this job for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Abubakarr and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Abubakarr will use his share of the loan (500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones, SLL) to buy films, blank cassettes, etc., for his cameras.

loans.use: to buy films, blank cassettes, etc., for his cameras.

loans.name: Akokoé

texts.fr:
Akokoè est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un couturier. Elle a 1 enfant de 3 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école.
Akokoè travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2011. Elle vend des friperies pour tous clients au grand marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Akokoè a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akokoè voudrait devenir grossiste. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Akokoè is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a tailor. She has one 3 year old child who does not yet go to school.
Akokoè has worked as a retailer since 2011.She sells second-hand clothes to all her customers at the big market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At present her main difficulty is shortage of stock.
Akokoè requests her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase second-hand clothes. She wants to reinvest in the business.
Over the coming years Akokoè would like to become a wholesaler. She says that with the profits she plans to pay for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme   mariée å un employé. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 9 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Essi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle est revendeuse d’alimentation générale. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Essi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale ainsi que des cartes de recharge. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Essi voudrait ouvrir une boutique et vendre en gros. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Essi is a woman who is married to an employee. She has two children who both go to school. The first is nine and the second is seven years old.
Essi has worked as a retailer since 2009. She sells groceries. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At present, her main difficulty is a shortage of stock.
Essi requests her second loan from WAGES in order to buy groceries and top-up cards. She wants to reinvest in the business.
In the coming years, Essi would like to open a shop and sell wholesale. She says that with the profits she plans to ensure her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Victorien

texts.fr:
Victorin est un homme âgé de 59 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants qui ne vont plus à l’école. Le premier a 31 ans et le dernier a 26 ans.
Victorin travaille comme menuisier depuis 1978. Il fabrique des meubles pour tous clients dans son atelier. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire à toutes les demandes.
Victorin a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’installer l’électricité dans son atelier. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Victorin voudrait accroître son rendement. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Victorin is a 59-year-old man who is married to a retailer. He has two children who no longer go to school. The first child is 31 years old, and the last is 26. Victorin has been working as a carpenter since 1978. He makes furniture for all comers to his workshop. He buys supplies in Lomé. He works alone. At the moment, his main difficulty is not being able to fulfill all the orders. 

Victorin has requested his third WAGES loan for installing electricity in his workshop. He wants to reinvest in his business. 

In the next few years, Victorin would like to increase his returns. With the profits. he says he plans to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to install electricity in his eecond workshop

loans.name: Portal Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Portal” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each borrower. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Alieu is the leader of this group. The thirty-eight-year-old is married to a trader and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Alieu has been a businessman for three years now; he sells breads. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bag of flour and other bread-baking ingredients in order to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour and other bread-baking ingredients in order to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.name: Tujimbere I Group

texts.fr:
Augustin fait partie du groupe Tujimbre I et  habite à Cibitoke,province sous la supervison de la branche de Bujumbura.Il  a 30 ans et est marié à Jeanne, commerçante de jus de banane. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de 2  à 14 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de peaux depuis  5ans. 

Il est à son  deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de peaux à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  prospérer dans son activité.
texts.en:
Augustin is a member of the Tujimbre I group and lives in Cibitoke, a province under the supervision of the Branche de Bujumbura administration. He is 30 years old and is married to Jeanne, a banana juice seller. Together they have 5 children, aged between 2 and 14 years old.
He has been an animal skin trader for 5 years. This is his second loan with Turame. With this KIVA credit, he will increase his working capital and purchase a large quantity of skins to resell at a profit.
In the coming years he would like to see his business prosper.

loans.use: to purchase animal hides to sell for profit.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a un enfant de 22 ans qui ne va plus à l’école.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des œufs pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir constituer un stock important.
Afi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des œufs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer ses besoins de santé.
texts.en:
Afi is a 44-year-old woman.  She is a widow and has a 22-year-old child who is no longer in school.

Afi has been working as a reseller since 2008.  She sells eggs to all clients, from her home.  She buys her goods in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her main challenge is that she cannot build up a large stock of eggs.

Afi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy some eggs.  She wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, Afi would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that with the profits, she is planning to take care of her own healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children; one of them goes to school. He has been running a business selling fabrics for three years now. He works from 10:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start building his house, bought more stock of vitenge (fabrics), and paid household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more fabrics to resell. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Chapakazi" which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is a 26-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. Gevorg is cultivating pleurotus mushrooms in rented premises. He started this business 6 years ago. There is high demand for mushrooms in the market and hence the business is profitable. Currently, Gevorg is harvesting up to 500kg monthly. The premises (170 sq.m.) that he is occupying today are not large enough for the business's further development. Gevorg has already signed a new rent agreement for another premise, which is twice as big. Another advantage is that the new one is in a deep basement, where it is much cheaper to provide the needed temperature and humidity for mushrooms cultivation. Gevorg plans to use this loan to purchase necessary equipment to grow mushrooms and install it. He also plans to purchase 1,000 bags of mushroom seeds to grow in the new premises. 
Gevorg lives with his mother. Gevorg's father died several years ago. Gevorg plans to provide himself with everything necessary in order to be ready for marriage. Development of the business is important for him to implement this goal.

loans.use: to pay for equipment and installation and 1,000 bags of mushroom seeds.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Komlan est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 1 enfant âgé de 3 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école.
Komlan travaille comme revendeur depuis 2004. Il vend des friperies pour tous clients au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Komlan a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Komlan voudrait acheter en plus grande quantité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Komlan is a 35-year old man, who is married to a retailer. He has a three-year old child who does not yet go to school. Komlan has been working as a retailer since 2004 and sells second-hand clothing for all sorts of customers at the market. He buys his products in Lomé and works alone. His main problem at present is that he is out of stock. He has requested a second loan from WAGES so that he can buy second-hand clothing. He would like to reinvest in his business. In the coming years, Komlan would like to buy larger quantities of goods. He says that he is planning to provide for his child's education with the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Siyaratou

texts.fr:
Siyaratou est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 4 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 1 mois.
Siyaratou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Siyaratou a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Siyaratou voudrait devenir grossiste. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Siyaratou is a 35-year old woman, who is married to a teacher. She has four children, three of whom are at school. The eldest is 12 years old and the youngest one month old. Siyaratou has been working as a retailer since 2001 and sells groceries for all sorts of customers in her shop. She buys her products in Lomé and works alone. Her main problem at the moment is that she is out of stock. Siyaratou has requested her fourth loan from WAGES so that she can buy general groceries. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, Siyaratou would like to become a wholesaler. She says that she is planning to provide for her children's education with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Umu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Twenty-three-year-old Umu was born in Bombali district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is single with no children. Umu sells clothes, jewelry, rubber bowls, etc., and has been a businesswoman for three years now. 

With the help of this loan, Umu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Umu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones, SLL) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business inventory. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Simeon.)

loans.use: to buy clothes, jewelry, rubber bowls, etc., in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Trorp

texts.en: Trorp is 58 years old. She is a mother to three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is involved in fattening up cattle. He earns about $2 per day. All of her children are employed. Two are garment workers and once is a mechanic. They earn about $8 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Trorp is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase motorbike spare parts for her son to resell. By doing so, her son would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her son’s business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her son to resell

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en: Dugersuren is 53 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife and elder daughter are employed, his youngest son is a school student and his middle son is a driver, working in Ulaanbaatar. He started his agriculture business in 2010. He plants potatoes, carrots and onions. He is an agronomist; therefore, his agriculture skill is excellent. He plants his vegetables on his brother's land. In the future he is planning to have his own land. However, due to not having a warehouse, he has to sell his products very fast and at a very low price. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to build a small warehouse to keep his vegetables and to purchase seeds to plant more vegetables. He is a smart and hardworking man who says, "Now that my son is attending college, I need to increase my income."

loans.use: To build a small warehouse to keep his vegetables and to purchase seeds to plant more vegetables

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa is 37 years old. She is the mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs the business of purchasing cattle to resell for a profitable price. He earns about $5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Channa is requesting a loan of $1500 to raise capital in her husband’s business to purchase more cattle for resale. By doing so, he would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to resell in order to increase her family’s income and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more cattle for resale

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en: Raksmey is 33 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband and her parents in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately 9 USD per day. Her husband runs a delivery service. In order to improve her husband’s business, Raksmey is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a tri-vehicle for her husband to run the business. By doing so, her husband would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a tri-vehicle for her husband to run the delivery service

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath is 57 years old. She is widowed and resides with a daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and making creel to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. 

Her daughter is employed in garment factory and earns about $5 per day. Sambath is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a plot of land for her daughter to build a separate house to live in after her wedding. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for her daughter to build a separate house to live in after her wedding.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 33-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son and one daughter. He opened a barber shop ten years ago, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but he needs to support his shop by making some changes to attract more customers.

Motaz is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of re-designing his shop and also purchasing a modern barber kit. This will improve the shop's condition to attract more customers and increase the quality and the size of his work, which improve Motaz's income and enable him offer to his family better living conditions. Motaz is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: to re-design his shop and purchase a new barber kit.

loans.name: Sareith

texts.en:
Sareith is 50 years old. She is widowed and resides with her six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 per day. 

Sareith wants to rebuild her house. With this goal in mind, Sareith is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money would enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn more income to support her family and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is 30 years old. She is single and resides with her mother and a sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been employed in a company for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Due to lack of funds, Sokhoeurn is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a sewing machine to use for sewing clothes to sell. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase more sewing machines in order to expand her business and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to use for sewing clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sareim

texts.en:
Sareim is 31 years old. She is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about $10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sareim is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for the family and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops.

loans.name: Masuba Group

texts.en:
Fatmata (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Makeni City about thirty-five years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple have three children – two are attending secondary primary school and the youngest is not of school going age. Fatmata sells clothes and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Fatmata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (1,400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy bales of clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes to add to her business.

loans.name: Yagamahoro Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie fait partie du groupe Yagamahoro et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 34 ans et est mariée à Jérôme, commercant ambulant. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de 1 à 11 ans, dont  3 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Les gains de son commerce lui permettent de nourrir la famille, payer les frais de scolarité des enfants, supporter les soins de santé,…Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait   acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Anastasie is a member of the Yagamahoro group and lives in Gitega. She is 34 years old and is married to Jérôme, a mobile salesman. Together they have 5 children, aged between 1 and 11 years old, 3 of whom study.
She has been a trader of staple items (rice, beans, salt, etc) for 2 years. This is her twelfth loan with Turame. With the KIVA funding she hopes to obtain, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of staples (rice, beans, salt, etc)  to resell at a profit.
The profits from her trading allow her to feed the family, pay the childrens' school fees, meet the medical bills, etc. In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of staple items (rice, beans, salt,...) to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr:
Esperance fait partie du groupe Shalom et habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a  29 ans et est mariée à  Amissi, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 5mois à 7 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce du riz depuis 4 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de riz à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une maison sur sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
Esperance is a member of the Shalom group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 29 years old and is married to Amissi, a driver. Together they have 3 children, aged from 5 months to 7 years old, 2 of whom are in school.
She has been a rice trader for 4 years. This is her first loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice to resell in order to make a profit. In the coming years, she would like to build a home on her own land.

loans.use: to purchase a significant quantity of rice to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Luka, who is in his late 30s is married with two children who go to school. He has had a barber shop since 2007. He works from 8.00 am to  10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to build a room for his salon, buy a Pikipiki (motorcycle) and pay household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wants a loan to buy more salon equipment and pay school fees. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Faith" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a forty-four-year-old married lady with eleven children who lives in Fort Portal Uganda. She has the personal goals of educating her children, building a permanent home and buying a car. 

She has been a farmer for the last twenty years after starting from her husband's land. She is facing the hardships of seasonal weather, price fluctuation and inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. However, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming, hiring employees to help expand her business and moving her business to a more permanent location. She has applied for a loan to help her weed her banana plantation.

loans.use: to weed her banana plantation.

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
John is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. John was born in Makeni City, thirty-nine years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. John sells used clothes and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, John and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. John will use his share of the loan (700,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a forty-two-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling baby clothes for four years. With the proceeds she has been able to promptly pay school fees for her children. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the different tastes and preferences of her customers. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Eva wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Hut

texts.en:
Hut is 39 years old, married, and has been residing together with her family in a peaceful village of Baray district. She is a good mother who is responsible for three single children enrolled in a local school. She and her husband, Pe, 49 years old, help each other in managing their rice farming business in order to provide the basic necessities, especially education, to their children. 

Hut said that she is just a low-educated woman who has encountered a lot of difficulties in life due to the lack of knowledge. And she doesn’t want her children to follow her path in life. She also believes that education is one of the best ways to alleviate poverty. 

With her first cycle loan she requested, she would like to purchase timber and wooden boards to fix and replace her wall. This will secure her family, who are often badly affected by the rain during the rainy season. She hopes to provide her family with comfortable living conditions. 

She is very happy and grateful for the support from all of you.

loans.use: to purchase timber and wooden boards to fix and replace her wall.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is 42 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a teacher who earns about $4 per day. One of her children is employed as a credit officer and earns about $5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Nary is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase fodder for breeding pigs. By doing so, her pigs will gain weight faster. 

In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for breeding pigs.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
La señora Ivonne es socia del banco comunal Las Lomas de Yarina de Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, está casada, tiene 40 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos menores, el mayor de sus hijos está por terminar el colegio.
Cuenta con una pequeña empresa familiar  que funciona en su propia casa, acondicionaron un ambiente donde tienen sus maquinas donde procesan las frutas (camu camu).
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000 nuevos soles comprara: 20 jabas de Camú Camú, 5 paquetes de bolsa plástica para embolsar la pulpa procesada.
El trabajo lo comparte con su esposo y dos personas más que le ayudan cuando llegan los frutos a la planta, en estos días la producción de la fruta ha disminuido.
Manuela ramos en estos siete años  ha estado presente en el crecimiento de su negocio que es el futuro de toda su familia porque tendrá que invertir en los estudios superiores de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Ivonne is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" (The Hills of Yarina), which is located in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has four dependent children. Her oldest child is finishing high school.

Ivonne has a small family business that operates out of her house. Her business is equipped with machines that process "camu camu" fruit.

With this new loan of 2,000 PEN, Ivonne will buy 20 crates of "camu camu" and 5 packets of plastic bags for packaging the processed pulp. She shares the duties with her husband and two other employees who help when the fruit arrives from the plant. In recent days, fruit production has declined.

In the seven years she has worked with Manuela Ramos, Ivonne has demonstrated growth in her business, which represents the future for her entire family because it will enable her to invest in her child's college education.

loans.use: to buy "camu camu" fruit and plastic bags.

loans.name: Khak

texts.en:
Khak is 54 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. 

She has been employed in a restaurant for more than a year, earning approximately $2 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

Khak wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. By doing so, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 38 years old. She is the mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and breeding pigs to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $15 per day. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her business, Sophy is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce farming expenses. 

In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Sam-Try Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sam-Try” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Neneh. Neneh is age thirty-five; she was born in Masuba, an outskirt of Makeni city. She is married to a farmer and the couple has five children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary school. For many years now, Neneh has been selling fresh fish. With this loan, she will buy fresh fish at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is 43 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of growing rubber plants to sell for more than three years, earning approximately $17 per day.
