She will share this loan with her loan group "New Africa" which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell and to start selling wigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer a 37 year old hard working lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has personal goals of educating her children and building a permanent house for residence.

She has been running a salon business for the last 15 years, after getting money from her restaurant business.  She faces a hardship of customers not paying on time, however,she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas and modernizing her salon to be one of the best salons in town.

Jennifer needs the loan to buy hair dryers for her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers for her salon.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.  She deals in phone accessories and has been in business for eight years.

She is a single mother, age 43, and charged with a responsibility of taking care of her three children.

Price fluctuations, inadequate capital and thieves threaten her business.  She desires to educate her children, buy a car and diversify her business by buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 52-year-old, married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

For 20 years now, she has been operating a stationary shop. Her primary business challenges are customers who often do not pay on time and insufficient capital to purchase inventory.

Her personal goal is to educate children, while her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Florence is seeking funds to buy books to re-sell.

loans.use: to purchase books for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is 32. He lives in Mrganush village with his family: wife, one child, mother and grandmother. 

Norayr works at the local school, and also provides car repair services. However, the main source of income for the family is the farm, where he cultivates land and grows different types of fruits and vegetables in three green houses. 

Norayr grows grape trees in his orchard, and they keep growing each year.  Norayr needs to purchase poles for the trees to keep their growth. He also wants to inject medicine in the trees and cultivate the land with fertilizer, to ensure a good harvest. 

This loan will enable Norayr to keep developing his farm and provide a stable income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase poles for the trees to keep their growth, tree medicine and fertilizer, to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 50 year old lady with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  

She deals in a restaurant and bar business which she started running two years ago.  Constance started with capital she saved from her salary as a health worker with Kagadi hospital.  

She says inadequate capital is affecting the business.  She would like to educate her children and expand her business to new markets.  Constance wants a loan to buy soft drinks, beers and food for sale.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beers and food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tires and to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman who is blessed with three children. All of her children attend school.

To earn a living, she sells school supplies, beauty products such as hair pins, nail polish, and cosmetics, as well as baked breads. She has been in this business for almost 18 years. Theresa and her husband aim to make her business more profitable so that she will be better able to support her children's education. She is glad because her husband is supportive of her work.

Theresa explains that she successfully repaid her previous loan. Now she is seeking a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to buy school supplies such as notebooks and paper for her stall. She believes that she will succeed and grow her business with the continuing support of ASKI and KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional school supplies (e.g., notebooks and paper)

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 28 year old gentleman married with four children, living in Kagadi, Uganda.

For three years he has been selling spare parts and radios. He started as a mechanic then saved his wages to start his current business. 

He says price fluctuation and inadequate capital are affecting the business.  

Emmanuel would like to build a permanent house and expand his business to new markets.  He wants a loan to buy radios and spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy radios and spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 24 year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent house.

He has been a farmer for the last three years despite hardships of price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather changes.

Christopher has a business goal of hiring employees to help expand his business.  He needs a loan to hire labor for farming and to quarry minerals.

loans.use: to hire labor for farming and quarry minerals.

loans.name: Ezira

texts.en:
Ezira is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the general-store business for four years. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high fuel and transportation costs.

His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home and buying a car. Ezira's business goals are diversifying his business to include farming, moving it to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets.

Ezira wants money to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been a hog raiser for three years.  He is 28 years of age, married with two children.  His priority is to let his children finish their bachelor degrees.  So, Joel has been doing his best in order to gain a bigger income to save for his children's education.

Joel would like to take out a loan of P25,000 to buy hog feed and vaccine to provide his raised hogs with proper nutrition.  He knows that he could make them healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. 

This would really be a big step in fulfilling his dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccine to provide his raised hogs with proper nutrition.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret a hardworking married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She wants to educate her children and build a permanent home.

She has been a sauce pan retailer for over ten years after mobilizing her personal savings.  Her major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  

However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas and has applied for a loan to buy more iron sheets for her sauce pan business.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets for her sauce pan business.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 33-year-old hard-working woman with two children.  She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals are to buy a car and build a permanent house.

Rosette has been selling clothes for a period of seven years and this has enabled her to educate her children. She faces hardships of price fluctuations, high transportation costs and the seasonal nature of the business.  However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Rosette needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena's daily activity is feeding and raising her hogs.  She currently raised one sow and eight piglets.  

She is in need of more capital to provide her animals with proper nutrition.  So, she is requesting a loan amounting to P40,000 to buy stock feed, vitamins and vaccine to improve the growth of her raised pigs.

Lorena devotes her time in her hog raising business because she aspires to gain greater profits to improve her homed-based store, provide for her parents needs and save for her future. 

She is the second child in her family and still single.

loans.use: to buy stock feed, vitamins and vaccine to improve the growth of her raised pigs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 39-year-old single mother with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for two years and this has enabled her to provide the necessities to her children,as she has sole responsibility for taking care of them. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand.  Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets.

Mariam is seeking money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes lives in Armavir town with his wife and son. Five years ago, this young and enthusiastic man decided to start his own business and become financially independent. He opened a booth in one of the city's busy areas, where he started making different types of fast food that are very popular among citizens. Due to his qualities of entrepreneurship,  Artashes has gained a loyal and ever-growing customer base. 

Now Artashes wants to develop his business and provide services with better quality for his customers. With the help of this loan he plans to construct a new booth. This will allow Artashes to increase his business income and invest in further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a new booth

loans.name: Kyanya Bakyara Thuwathikana Group

texts.en:
Eddy is 50 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for eight years. She started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as working capital.

Eddy is a member of the Kyanya Bakyara Thuwathikana Group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.  Eddy is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy beans and palm oil to sell. Her hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather changes.  Her personal goals are educating her children, buying a car, and building a permanent house. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding her business into new markets, and moving her business to more permanent location.

loans.use: to purchase beans and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been selling agricultural products such as pesticides for the past six years. This has enabled her and her husband to raise their children and provide them with all the basics. Her business challenge, however, is insufficient money to expand on her stock.

Jane is now requesting a second loan from HOFOKAM in the amount of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more pesticides and seed for resale. She envisions going into farming so as to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides and seed for resale.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi is a married lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She faces the hardship of inadequate capital to buy stock for her business.  Therefore, she has asked for another loan to help her buy more synthetic hair weaves and hair oil for her salon business.  She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets.  In addition, she has a personal goal to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy sythetic hair and hair oil to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 34-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has rented housing for the last seven years despite such problems as delinquent rent payments. She wants to expand her business, however, as it is low in operational costs.

Miriam is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to finish constructing her rental houses. Her personal goals are to build herself a permanent home and buy a car.

loans.use: to finish constructing her rental houses.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en:
Sadress is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For the past four years she has been in the bar and hotel business. Her main business challenge is theft.

Sadress is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy furniture for her hotel. Her business goals are to move her bar and hotel to a more central location and buy land upon which to grow crops. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her hotel.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a responsible father who owns and manages a rice farming business in his community.   He is 50 years old and has two grown-up children.  He aspires to educate his children and give them a better life. 

Despite the hardships Wilfredo faces farming, he has the determination to improve his farming business and increase his yields.  He has been a farmer for almost 25 years, earning a profit of 25,000 PHP in every harvest.  He utilizes this income to meet the family’s daily expenses and to pay his children’s school fees. 

To improve his farming business, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.  He believes that this loan will enable him to increase both his yields and his income as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 37 years old.  He is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda with his wife and four children.  

He has been running a retail shop for a period of 10 years.  He raised the capital to start this business by selling his crops.  He says price fluctuations and theft are the main challenges affecting his business.  Matia is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and plastics to sell.

He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For the past four years he has had a shop which he opened by saving the money he earned in his prior business as a motorcycle transport operator. Price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital are the main challenges he faces in his shop.

With a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from HOFOKAM Charles intends to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and salt to sell. His business goals are to move his shop to a more permanent location and buy land upon which to grow crops. His personal goals are to build a permanent home and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 43, married and has two school-aged children. He supports his family by planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. He also raises hogs to make more money.

Edgar wants to improve his hog-raising venture. He is asking for a 20,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy feed, vitamins, materials needed to improve his pigpen and additional piglets to raise.

Edgar aims to improve his family’s living conditions and continue sending his children to school. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he can give his family a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, materials needed to improve his pigpen and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For the past five years he has run a shop and charged phones to earn an income. He began his business with a loan from HOFOKAM. His main challenge is a lack of capital.

Friday is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell. His business goal is to move his shop to a more permanent location, while his personal goal is build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo primarily grows rice crops to sell. His income goes to meet his family basic commodities. 

Alfredo is requesting a loan for 45,000 PHP, which he will use to buy farm inputs to improve the fertility of his rice farm so that he can have a good production of rice crops.

Alfredo believes that he could obtain a plentiful harvest in the next cropping season because he is a well experienced farmer and hard working father to his two children. He hopes to send his children to a higher level of education so that they can find better opportunities along the journey of their life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to improve his farming business

loans.name: Eric John

texts.en:
Eric John is 25 years old and has a baby. He raises hogs to supplement his income. Despite the problems and difficulties of life he is determined to persevere, as he believes that through patience and hard work he will improve his business.

Eric John is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes that this loan will help his business grow. He wants to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

loans.name: Evaket

texts.en:
Evaket is a 28-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a beauty salon which she has operated for three years, and it is steadily growing. Customers not paying on time is her main problem.

Evaket is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM which she intends to use to buy dryers and steam machines for her salon so as to attract more customers. Her business goals are to move her salon to a more permanent location and buy land to grow crops on. Her personal goals are to educate her children so they might attend higher institutes of learning and to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy new hair dryers and a steam machine for her salon.

loans.name: Mortada

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty-two. He is single and lives with five family members three of whom work.

Since 2010, Mortada has owned a shop, for photocopying, printing and typing. He has a sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
 
He applied for $3000 as youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for another shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so that he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for another shop.

loans.name: Larba

texts.fr:
Larba est une femme âgé(e) de 59 ans. Elle est mariée å un  retraité. Elle a 03 enfants. Le premier a 32 ans et le dernier a 22 ans.  
Larba travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2010. Elle vend seule à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Larba a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon  Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Larba voudrait agrandir le commerce en ajoutant d’autres activités parallèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer son avenir.
texts.en:
Larba is a 59-year-old woman who is married to a retiree. She has three children. The first child is 32 years old, and the last is 22. Larba has been working as a retailer of charcoal since 2010. She makes her sales alone out of her home and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Larba has requested her first WAGES loan to buy sacks of charcoal. She would like to expand her business by adding concurrent activities. With the profits, she says she plans to ensure her future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is forty-two years old, married, and has five children. His wife's business is raising hogs to sell. Reynaldo is in the rice farming business. He has been planting and harvesting rice to sell for almost fifteen years. Reynaldo and his wife earns about PHP 15,000 a month from their businesses. They still aim for business growth. 

With this objective, Reynaldo is borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow. With proper maintenance of the business, Reynaldo is confident that someday he will achieve an abundant harvest which will pay for his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Salama

texts.fr:
Salama est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un  tôlier. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 04 à l’école. Le premier a 22 ans et le dernier a 08 ans.  
Salama travaille comme revendeuse de charbon et des produits cosmétiques depuis 1992. Elle exerce l’activité à domicile et de façon ambulante.
Salama a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques et des charbons de bois. Elle veut agrandir son activité en ouvrant une boutique et assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en:
Salama is a 42-year-old woman who is married to a sheetmetal specialist. She has five children, of whom four are in school. The first child is 22 years old, and the last is 8. Salama has been working as a retailer of charcoal since 1992. She operates her business in her home and door to door. 

Salama has requested her first WAGES loan to buy cosmetic products and charcoal. She wants to expand her business by opening a shop and to ensure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is forty-seven years old. He is married, and lives at Pinopoc with his wife and three children who all attend school. To generate an income, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been doing it for almost twenty years and earns just enough income for his children's education. He still aims to improve his farming practices, increase crop production and sales. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to maintain his farmland. This way, he will ensure good crop growth and someday get a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a responsible man. He works untiringly in his hectare plot of land which he cultivates and where he plants rice. Fidel is now twenty-seven years old, married to Rowena, and with no children yet. The couple is praying that they will have a child soon. 

Fidel would like to make his crops more productive so he needs a loan to maintain his farming business. He is asking for PHP 15,000 to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Fidel would like to keep achieving abundant harvests for overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Célina

texts.fr:
Célina est une femme âgé(e) de 52 ans. Elle est divorcée et a 04 enfants dont 01 scolarisés. Le premier a 30ans et le dernier 22ans.
Célina travaille comme revendeuse de farine de manioc et du SODABI (boisson alcoolisée) depuis 1990. Elle exerce l’activité seule à la maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Célina a requis son huitième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine de manioc et du SODABI. Elle veut agrandir son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Célina voudrait assurer sa prospérité  et subvenir aux besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
Celina is a 52-year-old woman. She is divorced and has four children including one attending school. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 22.

Celina has been working as a retailer of cassava flour and Sodabi (alcoholic beverage) since 1990. She carries on the business alone at home and resupplies in Lome.

Celina has requested her eighth loan from WAGES to buy cassava flour and Sodabi. She wants to expand her business.

In coming years, Celina wants to ensure her prosperity and meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: Buy cassava flour and Sodabi

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 39 years old and has four school-aged children. As a hardworking father, he aims to improve his pineapple plantation to increase his yields and make more money to support his family.

The cost of commodities and school fees, however, is high. So he is asking for a 20,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy the fertilizers and fungicides needed to develop his pineapple production.

Roberto hopes this loan will enable him to improve his plantation and the family’s living standards. He aims to educate all of his children so that they will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Warama

texts.fr:
Warama est une femme âgé(e) de 49 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 05 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 27 ans et le dernier a 10 ans.  
Warama travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes, nattes et foulards depuis 1975. Elle vend à toutes personnes au marché et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Warama a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes, des foulards et autres. Elle veut investir dans l’activité, l’agrandir et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Warama is a 49-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has five children, of whom two go to school. The first child is 27 years old, and the last is 10. Warama has been working as a retailer of pagnes (the colorful cloth of western Africa), mats, and scarves since 1975. She sells to anyone at the market and gets her supplies from Lomé in general. Her main difficulty is a drop in sales.

Warama has requested her fourth WAGES loan to buy 'pagne' cloth, some scarves, and more. She wants to invest in her business, to expand it, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth, mats, and scarves

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged twenty. He is single and lives with ten family members, three of whom work.

Karar has owned a farm since 2010. He sells calves and sheep. He has a sufficient experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
 
He applied for $2000 as youth loan in order to install a ceiling on the farm and buy more cattle food. He is aiming to gain more profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to install a ceiling on the farm and buy more cattle food.

loans.name: Clark

texts.en:
Clark is a young farmer and married man with two children. He grows rice on his 2.5 hectare field.

Clark is requesting a loan 40,000 PHP from ASKI to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seed for his field. He hopes to own a bigger rice farm and hire more laborers in his village someday. In this way everyone will enjoy a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seed for his field.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a farmer and single father of two children. To support his family he has devoted five years of hard work and patience to his rice field. He also sells furniture.

Joel wants to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field in order to get a better yield this year, but the money put aside for this purpose is no longer sufficient due to his furniture business expenses. For this reason Joel is asking for a 40,000 PHP loan from ASKI.

Joel hopes that his farming and furniture business will continue to grow. He wants to improve his family’s living conditions and save some to give his children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field.

loans.name: Mohssen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is fifty-one years old, married, and has five children.

Since 2008, Mohssen has owned a food market, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish and dairy products. He has a wide experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to repair his market’s floors and walls and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to repair his market’s floors and walls and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is forty-eight years old. He is married to Carolina, a vegetable vendor in their village, and they have four children. They work untiringly to generate income for the family especially for school fees. Teofilo would like to ensure good nutrition of his hogs so he is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed and medicines. As of now, he has invested his profits in school expenses. 

Some day, Teofilo would like to hope that his business will be profitable so that he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds and medicines.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is forty, married, and has seven school-aged children. He is raising his family in a village by planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Richard aims to increase his yields and income to cover his family's needs and finance the education of his children. 

To improve his farming business, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings. He mentioned that this loan will enable him to improve his rice farming business and he is hoping that he will be having a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Domitilio

texts.en:
Domitilio is a hog raiser in the village where he lives. He is now sixty years old, married to Maria and they have five children. The youngest child still attends school, the rest have settled into marriage. Maria also operates a small store to add to the family's income. 

Domitilio would like to ensure good growth and nutrition of his hogs so he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for his hog business. This will help his hogs grow healthier and when they achieve the desired weight, he can sell them at a higher price. This will lead to additional income. 

Domitilio would like to keep expanding as a successful hog raiser for the overall welfare of his family. From this, he will be able to save funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for hogs.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is fifty-three years old. At his age, he still plants and harvests rice to sell and generates income from it. This way, he earns about PHP 15,000 each harvest season, which is twice a year. He uses this income for meals and bills at home. He has five children. All have settled into marriage. Lito aims for business development to increase his earnings but he had insufficient funds. 

This is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay for the cost of labor for his farm. This will help maintain good crop growth. In the future, Lito would like to make his crop productive so he can get additional income. He hopes to achieve an improved standard of living some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay for the cost of labor for his farm.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from four to twenty-six. He describes himself as an organized man. He operates a restaurant where he sells tea, food and snacks. He has been involved in this business for thirty years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area.

He will use the KES 31,200 loan to buy a water tank. Charles has been determined to repay his earlier loan he had received from SMEP DTM. This is his tenth loan. His business goal is to run another restaurant within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a rice grower in the village where he lives. He has been growing rice to sell for over twenty years and earns just enough income for the sustenance of his family. He is now forty-six years old, married, and has two children attending school. His wife's business is raising hogs to sell for additional income. 

Rufino is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. This will help ensure good growth of his rice seedlings. 

Someday, Rufino would like to keep achieving abundant harvest in order to save funds for education and for use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis supports his family through raising crops. He is thirty-two years old, married, and has three children. He has been involved in this kind of business for five years.

Denis patiently cultivates his two hectare of farm land area to make a living. His wife is just a plain house wife who takes care of their children. Denis is really thankful because his wife is supportive in making their farm land more productive. He still wants to improve the rice field he manages so he can afford to educate his children and improve their way of living.

Denis is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 which will allow him to buy farm supplies for his agricultural business. He hopes that this amount will be approved.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta and her family live in their small house in Pinopoc. To make a living, the couple got involved in a farming business. They plant and harvest rice to sell. They sell it to traders in the village where they live. They have been doing this for almost twenty years and earn about PHP 10,000 each harvest season, which is twice a year. 

Violeta is now asking for a loan to have an additional capital to buy six bags of urea (fertilizer) and insecticides used in farming. She is borrowing PHP 15,000. This will help ensure a good growth of her rice seedlings.  

With a good profit from the business, Violeta will be able to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy six bags of urea (fertilizer) and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
Jingle is thirty-three years old, married, and has two young children. To earn a living, Jingle and her spouse work hard to acquire income. Jingle raises hogs to sell while her husband provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. They live in their small house in Capatan. 

Jingle hopes to make her hog-raising business became more profitable so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy medicines and hog feed. This way, she will ensure good nutrition for her hogs and will be able to ask a higher price for them when she sells them. 

With good profits from their businesses, the couple will give their children the best possible education and will some day be able to ensure a prosperous life for the family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and hog feed.

loans.name: Tamansane Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tamansane” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 900,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member of the group in order to invest in their businesses. 

Nanah is the leader of this group. Nanah is thirty-three years old. She is married to a photographer and the couple has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Nanah sells fish and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Nanah will invest in her business by buying cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is thirty-eight years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfast food for more than three years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband is employed in the prison. He earns about $3 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. 

Phea wants to build a new house. With this goal in mind, Phea is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase construction materials to build her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith is forty years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a midwife who earns about $4 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (Tuk Tuk taxi). He earns about $7 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Ith is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase medicine and midwife-equipment to use in her work. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase medicine and midwife-equipment to use in her work.

loans.name: Mikayel

texts.en:
Mikayel is native of a village in Syunik Marz. For the last six years he has been living in his uncle's apartment in Yerevan. The owners of the apartment, where he lives moved abroad several years ago. Mikayel's parents and his cadet sibling live in a village, where they have their own house and a farm.

Mikayel operates a rented shop, where he trades mobile accessories and sun glasses. He also repairs mobile telephones in the same shop. The shop is located in a very crowded area and hence Mikayel has many customers. This loan will give him an opportunity to start purchasing the inventory himself from a neighboring country. This will essentially increase Mikayel's profit, which he plans to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
Alik is twenty-five years old. He lives in Hartavan village with his family: his wife, mother, grandmother and little child. Alik has been involved in agriculture for five years, which is the main source of income for the family. Alik would like to expand the farm, but he doesn't have sufficient funds. This loan will help him to purchase calves and heifers, which will allow him to keep breeding the cattle and increase its numbers in the future. 

Development of cattle breeding is essential for Alik and his family, as it will allow him to earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for calves and heifers.

loans.name: Value Group

texts.en:
Mamusu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mamusu was born in Bombali district in northern Sierra Leone fifty-two years ago. She is married to a police officer. Mamusu sells clothes, firewood and charcoal. She has been doing business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Mamusu and her group mates will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mamusu will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes, firewood and charcoal at wholesale prices to add to her business.

loans.name: Atamu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Atamu” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each of them in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is forty-five years old. She is married to a trader and the couple has seven children. Two are in primary school and five in secondary school. Kadiatu sells groundnuts, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik runs a little factory, where he makes doors and windows. Garik started this business two years ago, and during this period, due to high quality of his doors and windows, has gained a large number of loyal clients and receives many orders. To complete these orders and do the work with high quality, Garik needs to purchase necessary aluminum profiles, glass and accessories for doors and windows. Thus Garik has applied for this loan. 

With the loan's help Garik will complete the orders properly, which is important for him to gain the trust and support of his clients and have new orders in the future. 
 
Garik lives with his wife and two sons. Development of the business is essential for him to support his family and provide better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for aluminum profiles, glass and accessories for doors and windows.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi lives in Salvard village with her husband and son. The family is involved in agriculture: farming and beekeeping. The village is located in a mountainous region, and it requires additional costs in order to meet challenges connected with weather conditions. This means that Armenuhi can't make savings to invest in land cultivation. 

Armenuhi has applied for this loan to start and complete land cultivation. She plans to purchase barley and potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel. Armenuhi expects to gather a rich harvest, from the sales of which she will earn additional income and invest in the farm next year.

loans.use: to pay for barley and potato seeds, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a married woman. She has three children whose ages range from three to twelve. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as being stiff competition within the area. She will be using  the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to be importing clothes for sale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children using the profits that will be generated.

loans.use: to buy  a water tank.

loans.name: Sanda United Group

texts.en:
Lamrana is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lamrana was born in Northern Sierra Leone about thirty-eight years ago. She is married and has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Lamrana sells cloth and has been doing this business for fifteen years now.

With the help of this loan, Lamrana and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Lamrana will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy bales of cloth to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of cloths to add to her business.

loans.name: Zmrukht

texts.en:
Zmrukt is thirty-two. She lives in Shake village with her husband, son, daughter and father-in-law. For already twelve years the family has been involved in agriculture: they cultivate potatoes and beans, and raise cattle. During this period Zmrukht and her family developed the farm and created all necessary conditions for its stable growth. 

Now Zmrukht needs investments to renew her agricultural techniques by purchasing new tractor wheels. She also wants to purchase special equipment to collect the grass, which is the main source of forage for the cattle. Zmrukht will also purchase fuel. 

This loan will help Zmrukht to organize the work more effectively and with less cost, which will allow her to save and invest in further development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for tractor wheels, equipment to collect the grass and fuel.

loans.name: Don’T Worry Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Don’t Worry” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. A native of Port Loko town in northern Sierra Leone, Aminata is married and has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Aminata has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells clothes and shoes. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of clothes and shoes to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes and shoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a forty-nine-year-old widowed woman. She has three children with ages ranging from seventeen to nineteen. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a a farm where she sells maize and also sells milk. She has been involved in this business for twenty years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to use the anticipated profits to venture into the business of building rental houses for provision of accommodation.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ta-Muyu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-muyu” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Abdul. Abdul is aged thirty-three, he was born in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has one child who is in nursery. Abdul has been a businessman for many years now. He sells used clothes. He has applied for this loan in order to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is involved in clothing retail. She has started the business seven years ago by renting a booth in one of city's markets and trading women's clothing. Yelena always selects appropriate fashions for different age groups of clients, as a result of which, Yelena has a large number of clients. 

Yelena would like to refresh the variety of her stock, which is why she has applied for this loan. A larger stock with more variety will allow Yelena to stay competitive and increase her profit. This is essential for Yelena to support her family and ensure better conditions for them. Yelena lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for women's clothing.

loans.name: Vitali

texts.en:
Vitali is forty-seven. He lives in Kapan town with his wife, son and daughter. Vitali runs a farm, where he is involved in farming and cattle breeding. Vitali would like to increase the number of cattle and develop his farm, for which he needs sufficient funds. 

With the help of this loan he plans to purchase two cows and two calves. Vitali dreams of establishing a big farm, where he will be able to create conditions for keeping more cattle, thus increasing his income from agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and two calves.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en: Selly is a fifty-five-year-old married man with twelve children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a parish chief for seventeen years and with the income he earns he has been able to construct a house and educate five of his children. His personal goal is educating all his children and he also plans to start a piggery project to supplement his monthly income. Selly wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Polina

texts.en: Polina is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years, she has had a drug shop business. Her hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving her business to more permanent location. Polina wants money to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Together As One” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadiatu who is pictured on the left. Kadiatu was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a trader and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Kadiatu sells market food – palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. She also sells cold drinks. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, margi, salt, pepper and cold drinks.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a forty-one-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for eighteen years. She started with one million Uganda Shillings and now has six million as working capital. Her hardship is customers not paying on time. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Enid wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a thirty one year old single mother with four children living in Kasese,Uganda. She has been in a retail shop business for two years. Her hardships are price fluctuation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. Personal goals are educating children and building a permanent home. Business goal are buying land to grow crops and expanding her business into new markets. She wants money to buy glasses and cups for sale.

loans.use: to buy glasses and cups for sale.

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en:
Ngano, who is in her late thirties, is married with three children. Two of them go to school; another one is still young. She has been running two businesses, a grocery and local chicken selling business for eight years now.  She works from 4.00 pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to purchase missing items for her grocery and started going upcountry to buy local chicken and deliver it to hotels and houses. She has paid all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the stock of groceries and to buy more local chicken to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her second house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Pera" which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of groceries and to buy more local chicken to resell.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
Dunia is a 37 year old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda.
He has a retail shop that he has operated for five years and this has helped him to pay school fees. 
Inadequate capital is the main hardship he is facing however his personal goal is to educate his children, build a permanent house. His business goals are to buy land to grow crops and to move his business to a more permanent location. Dunia needs the loan to buy sugar and cooking for sale.

loans.use: to buy  sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is fifty-six years old. She lives with her husband and four children. She has a grocery store in their village where she sells soft drinks, sugar, oil, coffee and vinegar. She is focused on her business because this is a great help in improving their economic conditions. As time passes and her customer’s needs grow, she doubles her seriousness. But seriousness and hard work isn’t enough. 

As a result, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy soft drinks, beverages, rice, and bread as additional commodities to sell. She hopes to gain more profits through these goods in order to be able to provide a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, rice, and bread as additional commodities to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is twenty-seven years old and still single. He currently lives with his parent. He owns a one hectare plot of land that he has cultivated for five years.

Julie is now asking for a loan amount of PHP 27,000 to ensure proper nutrition of his rice crop for a higher yield upon harvest. He will use this amount to buy farm supplies and to pay to prepare his land for planting. He aims to keep producing plentiful crops and earn bigger income to improve his life and to save for his bright future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay to prepare his farmland for planting.

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 2 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is one of the members of the Union y Desarrollo 2 (Unite and Development) group located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. She lives with her five children and her long-term partner. She enjoys being with her family, taking care of her children and attending to their needs.

Maritza has been selling clothes for around five years. She started her business with her own saving. She is receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of different types of clothes, for women, men and kids. Martiza plans to use her profits to save and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry patiently cultivates one hectare of farmland, where he grows rice crops. He has been involved in this kind of business for almost ten years. As he hopes to increase his yield this next harvest season, he is asking for financial support to lenders who have continuous source of income and so that eventually he can have a bigger farm land to plant.

Jerry is forty years of age, married, with four grown up children. According to him, the income being generated from his farming business was used for food, electricity and the allowance for the children. So the capital that he intended to use for re-planting his farm land is no longer enough. For this reason, he is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 which will allow him to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to ensure proper growth of his crops. He believes that his business will grow continually as long he has continuous access to the financial support of lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to ensure proper growth of his crops.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a fifty-eight-year-old man, he is married and a father of three sons and two daughters.

For the past twenty years, Mostafa has been making and selling bedroom furniture, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs and the project's costs.

Mostafa is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing bulk quantities of wood which is the only raw material he uses to make furniture. This will give Mostafa the wood he needs to continue his work and take more requests from customers. As a result, he will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Mostafa is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantities of wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a fifty six year old married man with two children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been dealing in rentals for nineteen years.His hardship is high taxes, personal goal is educating children and business goal is diversifying business. Abdallah wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been in active farming for eighteen successive years in his home area of Nyamira, South Rift Kenya where he lives with his family of three children aged between sixteen and five. He runs his farm with three temporary farmhands. He gets additional income from his jaggery processing business.

Samuel has requested a loan 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says he will use the farming income mainly to pay for the education of his children. He also plans to buy a vehicle to help in making deliveries to the market as well as bring in more income from transport business.

Samuel however says the major challenge in farming business has always been occasional dry spells that limit production.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Keki Group

texts.en:
Maganga, who is in his mid thirties, is married with three children. Two of them go to school and the youngest one is a baby. For a year now, he has been running two businesses: motorcycle and chicken feed sales. He works from 8.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling chicken feed, bought land, paid school feeds and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more chicken feed to resell and also to pay school fees.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house and to manage paying school fees for his children.

Maganga will share this loan with his loan group "Keki" which has a total of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed to resell and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel prepares his one hectare of farm land to be cultivated and planted with rice crops. According to him, the income generated from his previous harvest was not enough due to some calamities. For this reason, he is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders through ASKI, to provide him with additional working capital to recover his loses from the last crop season.

So he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for the cost of laborers to prepare his farm plot for planting. He hopes that he will gain more profit this next harvest season so he will be able to educate his three children and improve their way of living.

Manuel hopes and prays that he will acquire more farming skills so as to be able to succeed.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for the cost of laborers to prepare his farm plot for planting.

loans.name: Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Zuwena, who is in her early 30s is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a business of a food café for one and a half years now. She works from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy the missing items in her food café  and has paid back all her loans  successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more drinks, more snacks and increase  the food stock..  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Ngorogoro” which has a total of  12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, more bites and increase on the food stock.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Farming has been primarily the main source of income for Jacinto's family. He is a young married man. The couple are blessed with two healthy children.

Jacinto hopes to obtain an abundant harvest this next crop season to be able to have sufficient income to sustain his children's education and provide for their daily needs. To make his goal come true, he requested a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to purchase agricultural supplies to improve his rice field and keep producing good crops. In this way, he hopes to sell his crop at a higher price which will enable him to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to improve his rice field and keep producing good crops.

loans.name: Olfat

texts.en:
Olfat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in his store.

Olfat is a thirty-three-year-old young woman. She is married to Mohammad and is the mother of one son and one daughter. Her husband is employed, but the salary he gets is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past five years, Olfat's husband has also been selling computer spare parts and accessories, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Olfat is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more computer'spare parts and accessories. This will increase sales and improve the family's income and enable Olfat and her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of computer spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a farmer in the Nyamira area of South Rift Kenya. He is 32 years old is married with two children, an 8-year-old and an 8-month-old. He has been in farming for ten years and currently runs a farm which produces milk, coffee, bananas among other crops. He gets additional income from his trade in domestic animals.

Benard has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to boost his dairy farming business. He says this will provide more income to improve his family's living standards and educate his children.

Benard says the major challenge remains poor market prices in the local market for farm produce. He remains grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for providing farming loan services.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a father of four children aged between twelve and two years and has been in active farming for thirteen consecutive years with his farm producing mainly bananas, tea and avocados for the local market. He runs a retail shop business for additional income.

Gilbert has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him construct a dairy unit for dairy farming business. He believes he will be able to improve his dairy farming and grow his farm into breeding farm in the future. He is optimistic that the family living standards will be much better with the improved income.

Gilbert says the markets for farm produce are not well developed hence posing challenges to local farmers who prefer selling to local markets because of their small volumes of produce.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en:
Milyn, thirty-six years of age, is a hardworking and friendly woman. She is married and is a loving mother of two children. She operates a computer shop business to support her family, earning PHP 10,000 every month. 

Milyn’s income is insufficient due to the high cost of repairing and maintenance of her computer units. So, she therefore determined to ask for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase an additional computer unit and to repair and maintain her existing computer units. With the loan, she hopes to increase her proceeds every month in order to be able to meet her expenses and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer unit and to repair and maintain her existing computer units.

loans.name: Secours De Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
Dalo is a leader of a Community bank named “Secours de Dieu Plus,” which is composed of 25 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
 
Dalo sells second hand clothing. She started her business with the beginning capital of US $50. With hard work and determination, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to good management and accumulated profits. 

She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received two different loans and has repaid them correctly. She intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing two second-hand clothing bundles in order to increase the profit. Currently, she earns a profit of $90 every week. Dalo is married and the mother of six children aged between 1 and 17 years old. Four of them go to school. Her dream is to open a clothing boutique in her environment.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying two bundles of used clothing to resell at a profit in order to reinforce the working capital.

loans.name: Llesh Gjet

texts.en:
Llesh is a barrel maker. He is in his thirties, married, and a father of three young children; eleven, eight, and six months old.  They live in a rocky village in Northern Albania that is a region of great geographical and climatic diversity. The distinctive seasonal cycle of snowy winters, showy springs, cool summers and brilliant falls in the North has profoundly shaped the character and economy of the region. Most of the locals here are involved in livestock farming; a few of them in agriculture, and very few of them in specialized trade activities, with Llesh being one of these. He makes  wooden oak barrels that can be used for oil, vinegar & water storage and wine & beer fermentation/maturing.

In the last eight years that Llesh has had his own barrel-making workshop, he has sold thousands of barrels to wine producers and locals. There is a rapid growth in his business and he is now requesting a loan for the first time to purchase a large quantity of oak.
  
Kindly note that Llesh is the only cooper (barrel maker) in the whole district.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of oak

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Edicto is one of the members of the El gran esfuerzo ("the great effort") 1 & 4 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. This group is dedicated to sell by walking through their community and other communities nearby, carrying their products.

Edicto is a hardworking father of six children. He lives with two of them and their mother, and the rest of his children are living in their own home and in Haiti. He tells us that his biggest challenge is to have his own house, and he is saving his business profits to start building it. He operates a clothing sales business, and with this loan he will invest by purchasing products like shirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, underwear and other items.

Edicto is very excited to receive his 11th loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid his previous loan. He has had his business for about six years. His dream is to have a house and to live quietly in it with his family.

loans.use: To buy products like shirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario and his wife enjoy performing farm activities. This couple is peacefully living with their four children.

Macario is industrious and has patience in everything he does. He really appreciates his family because each one of them have their own assigned work to perform within their house. So, he has a great time cultivating his farm land. It's been ten years of sacrifices he has devoted to this field of business.

Macario would like to increase his profits to be able to obtain a better standard of living but his capital is not sufficient to pay for the labor involved in land preparation, transplanting and buying seeds to grow. In this situation, he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000. He hopes have continuous access to financial support to be able to succeed.

loans.use: to pay for the labor involved in land preparation, transplanting and buying seeds to grow.

loans.name: Prodige Plus Group

texts.en:
Prodige Plus is a group of 16 owners of small businesses chaired by Gisele. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Gisele is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells used clothing at market located at the mid-eastern part of Kinshasa. She became a micro entrepreneur in 2010. Gisele received already five loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. 

She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy three bundles of used clothing to resell at profit. Currently she earns a profit of about US $25 a week. She will seek to make more profit by selling more products.

Gisele is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children whose ages vary between 2 to 15. One of them attends school.

loans.use: to expand her inventory. She will buy three bundles of used clothing to resell at profit.

loans.name: Bénédiction Plus Group

texts.en:
Sylvie aged 40, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bénédiction Plus” which is composed of 6 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Sylvie has been part of the micro-enterprise since 2007. She started her business selling yoghurt, and gofers. Today, she runs a restaurant and mainly the Take Away service. She has many customers. 

Sylvie is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received ten different loans and has repaid them properly. Her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy more foods in bulk to meet her customers demand with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of about US$70 per week. Sylvie’s ambition is to open a modern restaurant in her area. She is married the mother of three children between the ages 9 months and 8 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of foods for her restaurant to meet her customers demand and increase her profits.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo has been in the agricultural business for seven years. He is glad because through the hardship he experienced, he is able to provide for his family's needs.

Marcelo wants to continue operating his farming business. So he is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to improve his farming business. Marcelo is looking forward to the positive impact that the loan he gets will have for him. He believes that he will be able to be successful in life thanks to the continuous financial support of ASKI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi lives in Nerkin Khndzoresk village with her husband and four children. Armenuhi and her husband run a farm, which is the main source of income for the family. As the family's costs are rising, Armenuhi wants to develop her farm and get more profit. 

With the loan's help she wants to purchase calves. By increasing the number of cattle, Armenuhi will get more income and ensure better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for calves.

loans.name: Fortune Plus Group

texts.en:
Musitu is the group’s leader. His group named “Fortune Plus” consists of 15 micro entrepreneurs who are united for the goal of growing their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.
Musitu earns his living by selling spare car parts, a business he started many years ago. He is 51 years old, married and the father of eight children between nine and 28. He has received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. He intends to use this loan to expand his inventory. He will buy more spare parts in bulk for resale to increase his working capital and profit. He will seek to earn more profit by selling more goods preferred by his customers. His ambition is to expand his business which is well located in the eastern suburban area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell.

loans.name: Lisanga Plus Group

texts.en:
“Lisanga Plus” is a group of ten small business owners chaired by Dodo. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Dodo’s main activity is to sell second-hand clothing in her area located east of Kinshasa. She started her business in 1986 with US$50 in capital. She has acquired solid experience in this business. Having repaid her sixteen previous loans from the MFI HOPE DRC, she intends with the next loan to buy a bundle of used clothing and resell it at profit. Currently, Dodo makes a profit of US$60 per week. Her ambition is to someday open a clothing boutique in her environment. She is married and has four children aged 14 to 31. Two of them attend school. She also takes care of other three grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ndue Gjin

texts.en:
Ndue is married and has four children with two of them still attending the elementary school. He owns a dairy farm and is requesting a loan for the first time. Ndue has been in this type of business for the past ten years and been able to establish a steady clientele. “Of course,” he says, “just like in almost every similar business, I’ve experienced the ups and downs of owning your own business, too. Only last winter, two of my cows died from the cold weather.”

With the profit that Ndue generated in the past, he invested in building up the dairy farm and, lately, started renovating their run-down house which is not finished yet.

Now, he wants to replace the two cows and this is the reason why he requested a KIVA loan via VisionFund Albania. With any profits, he will be able to finish the house and re-invest in business.

 Ndue is grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy  two cows

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is thirty-seven years old. She lives in a small village in the district of Sagarejo with her family: her husband Ivane who offers taxi services to the local population with his own car and their three children (thirteen, seventeen and nineteen years old). The younger children go to school and the nineteen-year-old son is a laborer on construction sites. Natia earns a living through an agricultural business. She has two milking cows and three calves. She produces cheese and sells it on the local open market.

Natia requested a 2,000 GEL loan to purchase calves. She will raise them and after they are grown, Natia will be able to increase production of cheese and other dairy food. She will sell produced dairy food in nearby villages. Thus, Naira will get additional income. With the increased income she will be able to reinvest in family agricultural business and this will positively influence the income of the family. Due to the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Victoire Plus Group

texts.en:
Gabriel is the manager of the group “Victoire Plus” which means Love in English made up of 20 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Gabriel is involved in selling cans of oil at the market located east of Kinshasa. He has been a micro entrepreneur since 2001. He likes his business and he is working hard to achieve his goal of one day becoming an oil provider in his area. 

He intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of his business goods to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business generates a profit of about US $100. Fifty years old, Gabriel is married and has four children aged between 12 and 25 and all of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business goods to resell at profit.

loans.name: Israël Plus Group

texts.en:
Tryphon is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Israël Plus” which is composed of 26 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Tryphon 53, and married, has been a micro-entrepreneur for years. He is a photographer and sells CDs in the North-east of Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area. His business brings in US $50 per week. 

He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by purchasing more blank CDs to meet his customers demand and generate additional profits. Tryphon is very happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups because he is going to achieve his dreams. He is the father of two children aged between 1 and 8 years old. The oldest attends school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his goods by buying more blank CDs to meet his customers demand.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is a thirty-one-year-old young man. He is married and a father to three sons and three daughters. He has been a taxi driver for ten years; and the income he generates is the only source of income for the family. They need more support to cover all the costs and to provide  better living conditions.

Atta is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi. This will make the taxi legal and enable Atta to move from one place to another freely and to take more requests and improve the family's income.

Atta is photographed next to the taxi.

loans.use: To cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi.

loans.name: Sabenti Group

texts.en:
